Sorry, We had to take a nap.

Jul 19, 2018

Last week Jitsi crashed because the Videobridge couldn’t keep up with the streaming from multiple rooms and multiple participants in addition to the other components required to run Jitsi suite.

There had been a tutorial posted by one of the Jitsi Developers on YouTube the week before on how to properly configure Videobridge to load balance when using the platform as VCaaS.

Luckily, after a little tweaking and adding another Videobridge droplet now [Jicofo balances the servers evenly to keep them from crashing. I really think 4 Videobridges and 2 servers hosting Prosody, Jicofo, and Jitsi-Meet components to evenly distribute their traffick as well would be the best bet. If one of those components fail it really does not matter how many Videobridges have been deployed because they are essential components to the suite as well.

So there are some things to consider and with all that being said the site is back up and able to host private parties.

Please send an email or hit me up on Twitter with feedback both good and bad so I can make sure everything is working correctly.

If there is anyone that might be interested in helping with setup of the WebRTC and other services which are slated to be launched within the next few weeks then please look me up on Github, Twitter, or email.
